intro: Bilabrella antennifera, commonly known as the feather-leaf bilabrella, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
